review_blob: Lord have mercy!  This is a world class IPA if ever there was one.  I bought  a pint for my friend and one for myself.  When I was half way through my second pint I threatened to drink the rest of his if he allowed it to  get unnaturally warm.  It must be respected as an unearthly brew of excellence.  Why do they not brew this more.  Rock art is all out !!!  WHY...  I love it too much

Forget the malty,  give me flowers flowing and hopping out of my IPA.  Not easy to switch to another beer, it makes other IPAs that I like a lot seem a little too malty in immediate comparison.  Cheers to you, cliff jumping freaks!  I will drink your six pack and not regret it  one bit ( as long as I have no late night whiskey!)

In an emergency ( only 2$ pint available) it is drinkable.  Not great at all.  This beer can give me a hangover after three.   I avoid it when Im smart.  Have one to make another beer taste better.   Sorry switchback, keep trying.

This is a good drinkable ipa.  It was actually the beer that turned me on to beer and kicked off a fairly debacular summer.  Hiding a six pack outside near the bar youre drinking at is a pretty good idea, cause theyre light and poundable, and also very delicious.  I do feel that they have had a recipe change for the worse in the past 4 years, seeming to have become much maltier, although my palate might have changed more than the beer.  Drink it and be happy to have it,   A crowd pleaser for sure

Love the hop selection, someone masterminded a glorious concoction here.  Although sweet, it hits the tongue with bitter hopiness more than enough dominate the sweetness.  It finishes with great floral and slightly piney remember acne on the palate.  There is a malty undertone that adds the perfect weight to the beer,  a warning weight that says , hey! Im 10+% and I can make you forget that fast !!! Yum yum yum

Wonderful !  This is a beer that you always want to have around.  The only reason I didnt rate this tops across the board is that the sheer intensity of it nullifies the taste buds so you can find yourself temporarily unable to gather the full flavor or the beer.  Sooooo delicious , but not there very best.

Holy shit !  This beer is amazing, but very, very strong. Beware drinking more than one, it may convince you that you have super powers or give you delusions of grandeur, or you end up just puking in the ally and stealing someones bird feeder !!!!!
I cant believe how inexpensive this beer is for the topmost quality !   Wonderful hops with a finish that tapers off to expose its lager roots in an unobtrusive, clean manner.
